author: Lukas Reiter
script:
"""
This script tries to convert HTTP response bodies into JSON objects and afterwards tries to extract the 
values of the JSON attributes that are specified in variable session["attributes"] (see Line 16). Note
that the specified JSON attributes have to exist within the same hierarchy level in order to be added
to the table above.

In addition, variable session["matches"] (see Line 17) specifies how many of the specified attributes
must exist within the same hierarchy level in order to be added to the table. This mechanism functions
as a customizable threshold to minimize false positives.
"""
import traceback

# Do the initial setup
# Update the contents of session["attributes"] and session["matches"] accordingly
if ref == 1 or "attributes" not in session or "matches" not in session:
	session["attributes"] = ["id", "username"] # TODO: Update accordingly
	session["matches"] = 2 #len(session["attributes"]) # TODO: Update accordingly
	header = ["Ref.", "Host", "URL"]
	header.extend(session["attributes"])

# Process only in-scope HTTP responses
response = message_info.getResponse()
if in_scope and response:
	response_info = helpers.analyzeResponse(response)
	body_offset = response_info.getBodyOffset()
	body_bytes = response[body_offset:]
	body_string = helpers.bytesToString(body_bytes)
	try:
		rvalues = get_json_attributes(body_string, session["attributes"], session["matches"])
		for item in rvalues:
			values = [ref, get_hostname(url), url.getPath()]
			for key in session["attributes"]:
				values.append(item[key])
			rows.append(values)
	except:
		traceback.print_exc(file=callbacks.getStderr())
name: JSON - Template Script to Extract JSON Attribute Values From Responses
